greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer solutions to a^2 + 2*b^2 + 3*c^2 + 4*d^2 = n.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
program: (PARI) q='q+O('q^70); Vec(prod(k=1,4, eta(q^(2*k))^5/(eta(q^k)* eta(q^(4*k)))^2 )) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 29 2018
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Oct 06 2018
